Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2009 08:48AM Renia wrote: Once again thank you guys for all your support and answers to my questions, that most of the time are dictated by anxiety and stress. Doing better though both mom and I. Got some results back  and still waiting for more.Appointment with the surgeon next, and more test. Hugs to all, and one step... Renia
Posts.Title: How much time between diagnosis and surgery? Renia Renia

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2009 07:03AM Renia wrote: I know I am going to sound like a broken record, but I have another question.  My mom's surgery was on March 16th, which is a month go. We had an appoitment with an oncologist last week, and with radiation oncologist as well. Now we got the results of the oncotype, which means starting radiation next. I called to make the appoitment for simulation ( the first one) and Dr Fein is on vacation next week, so the first one I got is on the 30th. Then it takes about 10 days for the department to get all arranged, and she will start her radiotherapy in mid May, or so. I am concerned that it is taking too long from the surgery to additional therapy. Does it matter how long you wait? I would imagine waiting to long is an issue, but how long is to long? A month or two? Please let me know your thoughts.
Posts.Title: How much time between diagnosis and surgery? Renia Renia

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2009 01:54PM Renia wrote: Thank you TexasRose, much appreciated reassurance.Good luck with the appoitment.
Posts.Title: How much time between diagnosis and surgery? Renia Renia

Posts.Content: Renia wrote: Guys,  My mom has been diagnosed on Feb 10th with IDC stage I/III combined score 4/9, still waiting for the ER/PR and Her2neu results. We had the appointment with general surgeon on the 11th and he refereed us to a colleague who is a breast surgeon and who most likely will take over the case. I was told that we should expect a surgery in the last week of Feb or first week of March. I am worried that we are waisting too much time, and not acting sooner. Please let me know, as even though I was reassured that the time elapsing between diagnosis and surgery is not too long, I am still worried. I welcome any advice, Renata  Log in to post a reply
